title: Select nodes directly instead of by color (was Allow control to be chosen by shapes)
author: chrisgoringe

comments.body:
I would agree that having many ways to add nodes to controllers could be confusing. 

But maybe this could be even more simple !

The "advanced" controls were a good idea, but with tabs for groups, they are mostly redundant,
( e.g. I will always use a ControlNet group, instead of adding these nodes to the advanced controls ).

People are used to placing nodes into groups, and they allow very complex workflows already.
If we add "advanced" controls on top of that, it's just going to be more confusing.

So if we forget the advanced controls, there is just one simple rule:

- **All nodes with a box shape will be added to the Controller** 
This will match the box shapes in the controller.
It would be easy for the users to understand and remember this setting.

- The node colors will still be in the Controller, but these will be just for highlights / aesthetics.
So, basically the same functions they already have in ComfyUI.

Advantages :

- Allows you to use all grey colors on the Controller. Some people, like me, prefer mostly grey colors in the GUI.
- Allows you to use more than 2 colors in the Controller.
- Allows to match all colors and node shapes in the Controller and the Graph.
- Simpler Controller GUI
- Simpler user settings

> So if we forget the advanced controls, there is just one simple rule:
> 
>     * **All nodes with a box shape will be added to the Controller**
>       This will match the box shapes in the controller.
>       It would be easy for the users to understand and remember this setting.

No thanks. My default is Box shapes for ALL nodes. I dont want all of the controls added just because of my workflow.

Same for "colors" really. This should be a key combo that triggers a menu item (add to controller). 

It would be much better to *NOT* hijack UI to use for populating other things, unless the node is marked to do so.

Why? Lots of reasons, like I said with the shapes, some people have color-blindness problems.

> It would be much better to NOT hijack UI to use for populating other things, unless the node is marked to do so.

Yeah, maybe that would be the best solution.

@chrisgoringe, Could you reconsider this ?

We could have an option to `add to controller` in the node's right click menu.

And the nodes could have an icon, in the top right corner, or something, to visually indicate they were added to the Controller.

Yeah, I think you've convinced me.

The idea behind (re)using colors was that we could have more than one panel. But that functionality is now done (much better) with the groups.

I'll do a right-click menu.
